channel.title: What should I blow my 18th money one...?
channel.description:
HTC Touch HD or Sony Ericsson Xperia - X1
[b]The Touch HD[/b] [code] Processor Qualcomm® MSM 7201A™ 528 MHz Operating System Windows Mobile® 6.1 Professional Memory ROM: 512 MB RAM: 288 MB Dimensions 115 mm x 62.8 mm x 12 mm (4.35 in x 2.5 in x 0.47 in) Weight 146.4 grams (5.164 ounces) with battery Display 3.8-inch TFT-LCD flat touch-sensitive screen with 480 x 800 WVGA resolution Network HSDPA/WCDMA:
* Europe/Asia: 900/2100 MHz * Up to 2 Mbps up-link and 7.2 Mbps down-link speeds
Quad-band GSM/GPRS/EDGE:
* Europe/Asia: 850/900/1800/1900 MHz
(Band frequency, HSUPA availability, and data speed are operator dependent.) Device Control
* HTC TouchFLO™ 3D * Touch-sensitive front panel buttons
GPS GPS and A-GPS ready Connectivity Bluetooth® 2.0 with Enhanced Data Rate and A2DP for wireless stereo headsets Wi-Fi®: IEEE 802.11 b/g HTC ExtUSB™ (11-pin mini-USB 2.0) Camera
Main camera: 5 megapixel color camera with auto focus Second camera: VGA CMOS color camera Audio Built-in 3.5 mm audio jack, microphone, speaker, and FM radio Ring tone formats:
* AAC, AAC+, eAAC+, AMR-NB, AMR-WB, QCP, MP3, WMA, WAV * 40 polyphonic and standard MIDI format 0 and 1 (SMF)/SP MIDI
Battery
Rechargeable Lithium-ion or Lithium-ion polymer battery Capacity: 1350 mAh
Talk time:
* Up to 390 minutes for WCDMA * Up to 310 minutes for GSM
Standby time:
* Up to 450 hours for WCDMA * Up to 390 hours for GSM
Video call time: Up to 120 minutes (The above are subject to network and phone usage.) Expansion Slot microSD™ memory card (SD 2.0 compatible)[/code] *Source: http://www.htc.com/www/product/touchhd/specification.html
[b]The Xperia X1[/b]
Mimics all of the above except:
-Camera is only 3.2MP but also has a Flash. -QWERTY Keyboard -Hot panel interface (although I've had the honour of trying HTC's TouchFlo3d. -It's dimensions are: 110.5 x 52.6 x 17.0 mm - 158g - (bigger) -Battery standby life is 800 hours! -Screen is only 3" but has same resolution. -Build quality will be better and will have some metal casing. (Basically more stylish) *Source: http://smape.com/en/reviews//Sony_Ericsson_XPERIA_X1-prev.html
[b]My verdict[/b]
Can't decide, the Xperia X1 hits the UK this month, the Touch HD hits the UK November. The X1 has that damn fine keyboard, and I'm unsure of whether ill like the touchscreen keyboard (never used one before). However the touch looks sleeker and has that 5mp camera.
The X1 is also reportedly laggy at times, but then again WinMo always has been. I might be able to get Android on them eventually of course.
Both have the same price tag... around £500 SIM-Free.
http://www.gsmarena.com/sony_ericsson_xperia_x1-2246.php http://www.gsmarena.com/htc_touch_hd-2525.php

item.title: What should I blow my 18th money one...?
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:17, topic:236776”]Uhm iPhones are shite compared to both of them lmao.

WinMo is far from terrible, the problem is most people just think it is because it was made by Microsoft.

I already have a decent SE phone, I’m just after something with broadband speeds and much more application flexibility.[/quote]What? The iPhone’s OS and touchscreen is far superior…
And no, that’s not why. WinMo is generally laggy and for most phones with it, although it’s touchscreen it’s still everyone’s preference to use the stylus that comes with the phone. (HTC Touch vs. iPhone, specifically)

Read full topic

item.source: What should I blow my 18th money one...?

item.title: What should I blow my 18th money one...?
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Greeny:

WinMo is far from terrible, the problem is most people just think it is because it was made by Microsoft.

On the HTC Touchs WinMo isn’t a great choice. I’m not a MS fanboy, but I’m no hater. I don’t bash things just because of it has an MS sticker slapped on it.
For one, the X1 has a terribly slow time realizing it’s sideways and when it does the animation is glitchy. On that note, the HTC Touch is also a bit slow when it comes to it’s animations. Doesn’t look as good as it should.
Then with WinMo, it means a lot of the stuff you’ll do still requires a stylus, gay.
The X1 I used was one that one of my dad’s business friends had. iirc, the X1 hasn’t been released just yet so it had to have been one of those randoms that get spotted in the wild.

I can write a small review on them when I get home from school, if you’d like.

Read full topic
item.source: What should I blow my 18th money one...?

item.title: What should I blow my 18th money one...?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Uhm iPhones are shite compared to both of them lmao.

WinMo is far from terrible, the problem is most people just think it is because it was made by Microsoft.

I already have a decent SE phone, I’m just after something with broadband speeds and much more application flexibility.

Read full topic
item.source: What should I blow my 18th money one...?

item.title: What should I blow my 18th money one...?
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

I’ve tried out both, and they’re really not that great. As a phone sure they’re fine but for all the extra money you’d pay not worth it. As much as I hate to say it, if you’re going to pay that much, just suck it up and get an iPhone.
Both touch screens aren’t as responsive as they should be, WinMo is terrible.
Go for something simple, but kick ass. Sony Ericsson S500i.

Read full topic

HTC not bringing Touch HD to the States

This shouldn't be surprising at all to anyone even remotely familiar with HTC's tendencies, but the Touch HD is officially not ever shipping to America (unless...
